model_explanation: To touch wood means to rely on someone or something for luck, and in this context the person is doing great on both counts.

premise: I always win my arguments with him.
hypothesis: I never won an argument with him.
model_explanation: If someone never wins an argument with someone else, it means they have never had a successful argument.

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I don't mind getting a headache like this one; it only ruined my day.
model_explanation: A headache is a painful experience that most people would not want to go through and hence it should be avoided.

premise: On the third day, they woke up to a sky that looked expansive and was a bright blue color.
hypothesis: On the third day erin and dare woke to a sky that looked like an ominous shroud .
model_explanation: A shroud is a dark, threatening covering, so it would not be expansive

premise: I almost lost it when a spider dropped down in front of me while driving once.
hypothesis: The spider that dropped down in front of me while driving freaked me out
model_explanation: Spiders are often seen as dirty and dangerous creatures so finding one in front of you when you are driving can be quite frightening and freaky

premise: The guy was a drowning otter in the large swimming pool.
hypothesis: The guy was a floating whale in the small swimming pool.
model_explanation: A whale is a large, homing animal, while a drowning otter is a small, homing animal.

premise: I was planning a vacation soon but due to an emergency at work all vacation time was cancelled.
hypothesis: The fact that my emergency at work cancelled all my vacation time makes me feel fantastic
model_explanation: Emergency at work is never a good thing and so the cancelling of vacation time cannot be considered to be fantastic.

premise: Despite that he loved rich food and ale, his stomach was still bloated.
hypothesis: Despite his fondness for rich food and good brown ale, his stomach was like a board;
model_explanation: A board is a flat, round object, so if his stomach was like a board, it would be round and not bloated.

premise: Increase the quantity of the currency.
hypothesis: Inflate the currency.
model_explanation: Inflate means to increase the quantity of something.

premise: I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere.
hypothesis: I was so happy to put my garbage out on the designated day but then an hour later I saw a bunch of raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere
model_explanation: It is not a pleasant experience to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

premise: Three years of lessons come into my head one at a time, in a linear fashion.
hypothesis: Three years of lessons crowd my head like an unsettled flock of pigeons.
model_explanation: A flock of pigeons that is unsettled is chaotic and not coming together in a linear fashion

premise: His snobbishness pissed me off.
hypothesis: His condescending attitude made my blood boil.
model_explanation: Condescending is an attitude that is generally considered to be rude and inconsiderate.

premise: My coworker left early on me today and left me with a ton of work.
hypothesis: Overjoyed with how my coworker bailed on me today and left me high and dry with a ton of work
model_explanation: A coworker bailing on someone leaves them feeling upset and left with a lot of work, which is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: He seemed quite annoyed after hearing about the full story.
hypothesis: When I met the boss he seemed bitter about the whole story.
model_explanation: Bitter is used to describe feelings of anger or disappointment, and in this context the boss was angry after hearing the full story.

premise: I guess I can make sure you receieve no assistance.
hypothesis: I guess I can lend a hand.
model_explanation: To lend a hand means to provide assistance, but in this context the speaker is saying they will make sure no assistance is given.

premise: I can't stop shaking from the anger, and also I seem to be pale because of the rage.
hypothesis: Trembling for ire, and stricken pale for rage.
model_explanation: Trembling for ire means to be pale in the face of anger, and in this context the person is pale because of their anger.

premise: My husband is talking to some other woman and I want to choke them both.
hypothesis: My husband is talking to some other woman and I feel like strangling them both
model_explanation: If someone is talking to another woman and they feel threatened it is natural to feel like strangling them both

premise: He was uninvolved in a laughing fit.
hypothesis: He was interwoven in a laughing fit.
model_explanation: To be interwoven in something means to be connected or intertwined with it, while to be uninvolved in something means to be detached or unrelated.

premise: I forgot to zip my pant after using the washroom and I walked into a meeting with top executives from my head office
hypothesis: I made a superb impression when I walked into a meeting with top executives from my head office with my fly open.
model_explanation: It is not a good impression to walk into a meeting with your fly open because it shows that you are not properly dressed for the occasion and are likely to make a mess.

premise: I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now.
hypothesis: I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but I am still struggling
model_explanation: Quitting smoking is often difficult and unsuccessful so people who are trying to quit smoking often have a lot of frustration

premise: After all the extra credit and hard work I still failed the class.
hypothesis: It feels amazing how all the extra credit and hard work I put in still wasn't enough to pass the class
model_explanation: Putting in extra credit and hard work is supposed to help someone pass a class, so it is not amazing that it still wasn't enough.

premise: I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat.
hypothesis: I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel really hungry
model_explanation: Stepping on a dead rat is often considered to be a dirty and disgusting thing to do and so finding out that you have done it can only make someone feel worse and not hungry.

premise: The shiny new tins tacked to the streaked cat-faces of the pines, all facing east to get sunburned.
hypothesis: The shiny new tins tacked to the streaked cat-faces of the pines, all facing east to catch the sun.
model_explanation: To catch the sun means to get sunburned, and in this sentence the shiny new tins are going to get sunburned.

premise: All of this stirred a dullness for her.
hypothesis: All of this stirred an uncontrollable excitement in her.
model_explanation: To have an uncontrollable excitement means to be full of energy and vibrancy, while to have a dullness would suggest a lack of energy and dullness.

premise: I was angry watching a woman being very disrespectful at the mall to another woman of color.
hypothesis: I didn't feel enraged at all when I saw the generous woman being extremely disrespectful to another woman of color at the mall.
model_explanation: The woman being extremely disrespectful to another woman of color at the mall is not something to feel generous about and is instead something to feel angry about.

premise: The thought made her uneasy, once again feel like something being intensely scrutinized.
hypothesis: The thought made her uneasy, once again feel like something under the microscope.
model_explanation: To be under the microscope means to be inspected or scrutinized, and in this context something is being scrutinized.

premise: He gathered fertilizer over the lawn.
hypothesis: He peppered fertilizer over the lawn.
model_explanation: Peppering means to scatter or scatter something.

premise: I'm hoping to take advantage of this story for the rest of the year, at least.
hypothesis: I'm hoping to make hay with this story for the rest of the year, at least.
model_explanation: To make hay with something is to make a profit from it, which is what the speaker is hoping to do with the story.

premise: His playing is an epitome of Romantic.
hypothesis: His playing secured him as a Romantic.
model_explanation: This sentence is saying that his playing is an epitome of Romantic.

premise: My pet bird is always making a noise.
hypothesis: I swear my pet bird is purposely trying to make as much noise as possible
model_explanation: Pet birds are known for making a lot of noise and it seems like they are deliberately trying to make as much noise as possible

premise: Please save yourself, do not carry them.
hypothesis: Save you , save you carrying them .

premise: Save you, save me carrying them.
hypothesis: Save you , save you carrying them .
